qas.question: How many kilometers of sewer lines exist in Richmond?
How much water is contained in Shockoe Retention Basin?
How many Richmond inhabitants get their water from the wastewater treatment plant?
How much sewage and stormwater can the treatment plant adjacent to the James River treat daily?

context: The wastewater treatment plant and distribution system of water mains, pumping stations and storage facilities provide water to approximately <a2_0>62,000<a2_0/> customers in the city. There is also a wastewater treatment plant located on the south bank of the James River. This plant can treat up to <a3_0>70 million gallons<a3_0/> of water per day of sanitary sewage and stormwater before returning it to the river. The wastewater utility also operates and maintains 1,500 miles (2,400 km) of sanitary sewer and pumping stations, 38 miles (<a0_0>61<a0_0/> km) of intercepting sewer lines, and the Shockoe Retention Basin, a <a1_0>44-million-gallon<a1_0/> stormwater reservoir used during heavy rains.
